Articles.Content: HEY! I was landing with my lander to the moon, but when i lowered My LT-2 Struts they were bend on part that lands. I dont know what this is could somebady tell me. I dont know how to get them properly?

Are you talking about the feet of the legs being pointed up when you are flying?  If so, I'm pretty sure that is the standard orientation for them, and they are only flat down when in contact with the ground.  Hope this helps!

Welcome to the forums.

HeliosPh0enix is right. The feet on the LT-2 only look like they are flat when you are landed on the ground. The feet are just visual; they do not change the way the landing legs work.
